content.description: The researchers determined that the East lava flow population is not in Hardy-Weinberg equilibrium.
content.question: Which of the following best explains why the population is not in Hardy-Weinberg equilibrium?

choices.label: The presence of heterozygotes for the <math alttext="M C l R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi><mi>C</mi><mstyle mathvariant="italic"><mn>1</mn></mstyle><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> gene in the East lava flow population indicates that mating is occurring randomly between mice with different coat colors.
The selective pressures on the East lava flow population are not strong enough to maintain Hardy-Weinberg equilibrium.
The East lava flow population does not experience migration, which is a required condition for Hardy-Weinberg equilibrium.

The presence of <math alttext="M C l R lower case d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi><mi>C</mi><mstyle mathvariant="italic"><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle><mi>R</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>d</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> alleles in the East lava flow population is an indication of gene flow from mice populations living on light granite rocks.

content.answer: The presence of <math alttext="M C l R lower case d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi><mi>C</mi><mstyle mathvariant="italic"><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle><mi>R</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>d</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> alleles in the East lava flow population is an indication of gene flow from mice populations living on light granite rocks.

skill.text: 1.C: Explain biological concepts and processes in applied contexts.
